metadata.Title: CVE-2016-10318 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
A missing authorization check in the fscrypt_process_policy function in fs/crypto/policy.c in the ext4 and f2fs filesystem encryption support in the Linux kernel before 4.7.4 allows a user to assign an encryption policy to a directory owned by a different user, potentially creating a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-10318` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-47-generic - 4.4.0-47.68~14.04.1
